programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. As he concludes his trek in the river's coastal reaches, he faces a crisis of conscience as he witnesses a traditional crocodile hunt.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the impact of the conquest of Britain and Ireland, and learns how William the Conqueror built scores of castles and cathedrals to impose his control and intimidate the population. The ruler also commissioned the Domesday Book to survey the wealth of the land and raise revenue, and set in motion the linguistic and cultural transformation of England. The Normans blended well in Scotland, but faced fierce opposition in Wales, and promoted divisions in Ireland which some claim still exist to this day.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, travels to Paris to reveal Napoleon's relationships, from nervous first encounters with a prostitute to his all-consuming love for Josephine, his Empress consort. She visits the statesman and military leader's former home Malmaison and the Palace of Fontainebleau to view his throne room and reveals the secrets to his extraordinary success - and calamitous downfall.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, Dr Tracy Borman travels to Germany to uncover Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler's abusive childhood and artistic aspirations. She reveals how he was shaped by the First World War and uncovers his relationships with much younger women, including his own niece, discovering how the personal motivations that came from his private life unleashed so much destruction.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman travels to St Petersburg, to reveal how Emperor Peter the Great's unconventional childhood produced a very unconventional man - from the debauched drinking society that governed Russia to his collection of oddities in the Kunstkamera museum. She also discovers how the enlightened yet brutal Peter managed to drag Russia towards the modern age.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman heads to Chicago to discover how Al Capone rose to infamy, from club bouncer to the most notorious gangster in history. She uncovers the two sides to his personality, as the man who ordered deaths on a whim doted on his family, and reveals how his carefully curated public image gave birth to a legend.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall leads a team into Yucatan, Mexico on the trail of the ancient Maya. Uncovering sinister secrets and artefacts, they push far into the underworld of the Maya.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: Prince Andrew discusses his stint in the Falklands and what it's really like to confront your own mortality, while Prince Edward's decision to quit his marine training is examined.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Exploring the high cost of surviving the sinking, including the tragic story of Frederick Fleet, one of two lookouts, whose quick actions may have averted an even great disaster.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the world's biggest oil tanker - the mighty Supertanker Europe of the record-breaking TI Class of ship.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: The Normans

Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The unsolved murders committed by the Butcher of Kingsbury Run, a serial killer operating in Cleveland, Ohio, in the 1930s. The Butcher killed at least 12 men and women, dismembering their bodies and scattering them across the city.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene decides to run for the Spanish border but is stopped before he can make it across - and General Von Klinkerhoffen gets hold of the painting. The British airmen become trapped in wine barrels in the cellar of the chateau.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen orders Edith to marry Captain Bertorelli as a propaganda exercise, while the resistance tries to rescue the airmen who are trapped in wine barrels in the chateau's cellar. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen get stuck down the drain in the village square, and Rene plans to rescue them using an old ice-cream van. As a result, General Von Klinkerhoffen gets more than he bargained for when he decides to buy one of the cool refreshments on sale. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.desc: The remains of three U-boats discovered in the Bristol Channel. programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. programme.desc: The theories, conspiracies and facts relating to Rudolf Hess's dramatic flight to Scotland in 1941 and his subsequent death in Spandau prison.

The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The fate of a Canadian warship that went to the aid of an American freighter rocked by an explosion in 1944. More than 60 years on, divers uncover new evidence of the sinking.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When Hitler Lost the War
programme.desc: How the Nazi invasion of Russia in 1941 would lead directly to Hitler's ultimate downfall four years later.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: As the Allies' advances stall, the Canadians seize Hitler's island fortress to open up the vital port of Antwerp and keep the war moving.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Dave and Steve spot something special at auction, but they're not the only ones on the trail of this First World War pilot's logbook.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Spoonerisms galore with Barker and Corbett, and another instalment of the gripping Death Can Be Fatal, with a musical finale to finish.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Continuing the saga of Death Can Be Fatal, as well as a guest appearance from the Aldershot Brass Ensemble and Patrick Moore's brother.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: As the Allies' advances stall, the Canadians seize Hitler's island fortress to open up the vital port of Antwerp and keep the war moving.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the validity of the Bible's best-known stories. Two different theories about Moses' dramatic parting of the Red Sea are examined. The original Hebrew version of the Bible contains references to a 'reed sea' where it is thought the crossing may have occurred.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: John Christie: Serial Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part profile of John Christie, looking at how his crimes were blamed on an innocent man, who was sentenced to death.

programme.desc: An investigation into a wreck in the Bristol Channel identified by divers as a First World War hospital ship, the sinking of which constituted a major war crime.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.sub-title: The Day When Churchill Chose War
programme.desc: Pivotal moments in history recreated using archive materials and dramatic reconstructions, beginning with Churchill persuading the British government to go to war.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies entered Germany and ran into the imposing Siegfried Line defences. American troops fought to a gruelling, bloody standstill in the Huertgen Forest, at a terrible cost.

programme.desc: Divers explore the wreck of First World War battleship HMS Audacious, which was once the pride of the Royal Navy and thought to be 'unsinkable' until a single unexpected blow sealed its fate 14 miles off the coast of Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When De Gaulle Chose War
programme.desc: Charles De Gaulle's refusal to surrender to the German invasion of France in 1940, and his subsequent escape to London and establishment of a French government in exile.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Hitler's launch of his great counter-offensive against the unsuspecting Allies in the Ardennes. This was the Nazis' last gamble in the West to turn the tide of the war.

programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Maggie returns from Thailand with her new toy boy. Bayleaf is found not guilty in court, while Jean and Sicknote continue to get along swimmingly.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A woman's corpse is discovered in a ploughed field, and the only lead is her husband, a potter. A year earlier, he suddenly decided to start a new life as a monk, suggesting that his wife may have committed suicide because she could not bear to lose him to the brethren - or that her spouse may have had a hand in her death. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Rev Harry Nettles bets the antiques dealer that a field next to a church contains a Roman mosaic. Drama, guest starring David Kossoff, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's teenage daughter goes missing, while an MP's son develops a profitable sideline in forged paintings. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Work at Thornley Manor is over and the lads take a break before leaving for Spain. Oz uses the opportunity to visit home and hits on the barmy idea of kidnapping his son, determined to prevent him from being taken overseas by his wife Marjorie - but makes the mistake of roping Wayne in to help.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Tempers fray as the boys' flight to Spain is postponed, so Ally Fraser tries to calm things down by inviting them all back to his flash residence for drinks - where Wayne's libido soon leads him into trouble. With Jimmy Nail, Gary Holton and Bill Paterson.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connolly's supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm).

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Shepherd and his team are confronted with the sight of a Santa Claus with a slit throat. The victim is actually much-loved local mayor Evan Whitestone, who had dressed as Santa every year for the Christmas parade. Suspicion soon turns to the four rivals for his mayoral chains in a forthcoming election. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Sequel to hit fantasy drama Life on Mars. Alex Drake, a single mother working as a police psychologist in 2008 is shocked to wake up in London in 1981 after being shot. DCI Gene Hunt, DS Ray Carling and DC Chris Skelton, transferred to the Met, swiftly come to her rescue. She knows all about the trio having spent months reading Sam Tyler's reports of his time in the past, but cannot understand why she is sharing his delusion. Starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: DCI Hunt is determined nothing will spoil Diana Spencer's wedding, and so sets out to prevent a potentially explosive protest getting out of hand. When it seems Thatcherite playboy Danny is in danger, Alex is assigned to look after him - but after a speedy ride in a DeLorean leaves her in no fit state for work, Gene and Ray set out to crack the case. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert's brother Frank comes to stay - and presents the private detective with another intriguing case in the final episode of the light-hearted drama. The daughter of Frank's old flame has gone missing from her new job in a Victorian heritage museum and early investigations indicate that Marianne was last seen running out of the museum in her school mistress costume, following a row with the manager.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Now that Hetty and her husband are back from their trip to Australia, the Wainthropp Detective Agency can get back to some serious sleuthing. However, the first case to crop up is far from typical - it involves hunting for buried treasure in the wilds of Cumbria. Patricia Routledge stars as the modern-day Miss Marple, with Derek Benfield, Dominic Monaghan and Lesley Dunlop.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: McKenna becomes obsessed with the wife of a wounded war veteran he is treating, while Finlay and Cameron are intrigued by a film star staying in a local hotel. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron agrees to help trace Millie Calm's real mother, but soon wishes he had never got involved. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Neil's world begins to collapse around his ears when his meeting with a key witness in the money laundering trial is followed by her attempted kidnapping. Already paranoid after discovering a bug in his house and an intruder rummaging through his rubbish, the confused copper begins to wonder if somebody's trying to frame him - and his suspicions are confirmed when he's beaten up, drugged and awakes to find himself next to a murdered man.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. Ever resourceful, Neil pretends to have hard evidence that a corrupt copper is responsible for his predicament - deliberately provoking an attempt on his own life as a way of proving his innocence.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert's brother Frank comes to stay - and presents the private detective with another intriguing case in the final episode of the light-hearted drama. The daughter of Frank's old flame has gone missing from her new job in a Victorian heritage museum and early investigations indicate that Marianne was last seen running out of the museum in her school mistress costume, following a row with the manager.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to grant Sam his final wish and sneak him out of his sick-bed for a secret rendezvous - but when he drops dead, things begin to get out of hand. Feature-length Christmas special from 1983, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth receives a cryptic letter from a recently deceased acquaintance asking her to conduct a mysterious investigation. Instructed only to go on a coach tour of historic homes around England, she uncovers murder and intrigue. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, with Peter Tilbury, John Horsley and Helen Cherry.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Reid and Ross investigate the discovery of a mutilated body on a remote island, but find the locals strangely uncommunicative and struggle to make headway. Back in Glasgow, Burke and Fraser link the victim to a drugs operation thanks to a tattoo on his arm - but just as their investigation appears to be on the right track, a mysterious disappearance complicates the case still further.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke promises to help an old flame working for a politician who is in trouble for accepting funds from an underworld figure. The investigation into the criminal leads Burke to a shady escort agency, but the case and his reputation are jeopardised when he is caught on camera leaving the building after a raid by vice officers. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Joe's future in the army hangs in the balance, as Honor struggles to cope with the revelations about his secret past. Markham is torn between his duty and his conscience, while Armstrong fears for Yusra's safety.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave and Donna's relationship is threatened, and Paddy Garvey and Nancy Thorpe make some important decisions. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna's past comes back to haunt her when she meets the teenager who asked her for an abortion pill a few weeks earlier. It transpires the girl is now pregnant again, and her mother shows up at the hospital to find out exactly what's going on. Matters are further complicated when Owen learns she is only 15 years old - and also discovers how the nurses falsified her records. Meanwhile, Connie begins to lose patience with Elliot.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy brings baby Milo to see everyone on her way home. Meanwhile, Eve and Gerry want to throw Frank out when they catch him about to take drugs in the toilets.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is questioned about Vicki's disappearance as the search for her intensifies.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Duncan's pen-pal comes to stay, but it soon transpires he has been less than truthful in his letters to her, implying he not only owns Glenbogle, but is the Laird. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie, Hamish Clark and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates corporate scandals on Jersey while Danielle grows convinced his life is in danger, but nobody will believe her. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's poetry is to be published, much to the delight of his Italian girlfriend. Joeys and Jack's love lives, however, are in deep trouble.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted has a chance of stardom when he is hired as a late replacement at an uptown show for a fellow comedian. It is rumoured that talent scouts from the TV show Opportunity Knocks will be in the audience. Classic comedy following life at Maplin's holiday camp, starring Paul Shane, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.sub-title: The World Will Always Welcome Lovers
programme.desc: The truth about Alistair's wedding nerves is revealed after he and Lionel spill the beans, but Rocky comes to the rescue to ensure the ceremony finally takes place. Jean refuses to give up on her efforts to play Cupid between Harry and Sandy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man admitted to hospital after a traffic accident turns out to be one of two children who disappeared without trace 15 years previously. At the time, a nationwide manhunt failed to produce any answers, and now the cold case squad investigates where the missing boy has been all this time and whether his twin sister is still alive. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric pushes to perform extreme surgery on one of his patients, with disastrous consequences for himself. Meanwhile, Owen finally decides between Chrissie and Diane.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean and Chloe are sent to Holby police station to treat a prisoner injured by an angry mob who suspect him of shooting a local teenager _ but they are soon forced to go beyond the call of duty as events take a dramatic and dangerous turn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle is still anxious about Vicky and can't seem to get over the shock of her abduction. Sharon wants to teach Grant a lesson.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle is still struggling with the trauma of Vickys kidnapping. She must deal with it when she comes face to face with kidnapper Ms. Whittingham.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blackwall firefighters called out to a BMX rider trapped beneath a collapsed wall, and an institute for juvenile offenders which has gone up in flames. On the domestic front, the team receive a letter from injured workmate Colin, while Kevin faces homelessness and Bayleaf grows disillusioned with the job. Starring James Hazeldine, Glen Murphy, Andrew Kazamia, Ross Boatman and Sean Blowers.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector's former Army pal and reputed jewel thief Toad returns to Britain determined to set the record straight with his old friend, leaving Archie and his father trying to decide whether or not to aid his escape from the police. Things get worse when Lexie accidentally puts a hole in a valuable regimental painting, leaving the cash-strapped estate facing a huge bill.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim searches for a runaway wife and becomes embroiled in a cult who believe in the existence of Atlantis. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack arrives home drunk, Aveline puts her desire for a baby on hold, and Nellie meets her admirer in the park.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.sub-title: Hey Diddle Diddle, Who's on the Fiddle?
programme.desc: Peggy finds a letter from Joe Maplin to Clive, leading the camp to believe they have a mole in their midst. Classic comedy, starring Su Pollard and David Griffin.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: With Alistair and Judith happily married, Harry tries to find the courage to ask Sandy to move to Canada with him, and Lionel has his usual doubts about his relationship with Jean when she takes pity on a homeless girl. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Everard hands down a lenient sentence to a political benefactor accused of running over a mother and her two children. Deed accuses him of corruption, and Monty responds by putting pressure on Jo, ostracising her to the point where she begs her friend to back down. True to form, John continues to push for the result he wants a tougher sentence but there may be a price for him to pay.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A mummified body found on a derelict aeroplane leads Boyd and the team to a man convicted in a similar case, who Spence gets to know undercover. The victim's uncle reveals the dead man's connections with a corrupt businessman selling fake drugs - but a tragedy foils the detectives' work. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

Starring James Hazeldine, Glen Murphy, Andrew Kazamia, Ross Boatman and Sean Blowers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. As Marsha's troubles deepen, she finds solace in a bottle and spurns all offers of help from her friends, while Williams and Phillips' relationship reaches a turning point.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane applies for a consultant's job, and Owen tries to shut Chrissie out - but she won't take no for an answer. The board put pressure on Connie to make a statement about Michael, though she's reluctant to get involved. Dean meets a woman in a lift who asks him to provide her with painkillers. However, when it turns out she is an actress hired for his practical exam, he may have jeopardised his chances.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Adam's father pays an unscheduled visit, and a groom's stag night goes disastrously wrong. Meanwhile, Chloe takes time out to reflect on her liaison with Sean and Josh's gambling habit starts getting the better of him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Lack of Control - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Adam's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Phil tempts fate by flirting with Samantha, while Suzie monitors a recently released child abuser, but makes the mistake of contacting his daughter - who is so distressed that she attempts suicide shortly afterwards.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian is desperately seeking Cindy, Mrs Hewett is looking for Arthur and Grant is as always looking for trouble.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant is getting more and more angry with Sharon. Dot is back on the square. Rose is saying goodbye to Pete.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: As Bayleaf recovers from the attack, a high-ranking officer arrives at the station to interview Nick about the prison incident. Pearce and his busybody wife Patti unwittingly find themselves the centre of attention at Recall's charity event for Great Ormond Street Hospital, and the hard-pressed Blue Watch firefighters are called to a blaze in a library basement. Ben Onwukwe, James Hazeldine, Ross Boatman and Glen Murphy star.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie organises a magnificent midsummer ball, hoping the event will make it clear to his peers that he has regained full control of the estate before Stella departs. However, she is less than keen to leave and plots to sabotage the entire event. With all the bank's top brass in attendance, Archie's future hangs in the balance. Drama, starring Alastair Mackenzie.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: An enigmatic character claims his life is in danger and calls Jim out to his remote castle in Brittany to act as his bodyguard. Drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell is about to celebrate her birthday when she receives some shattering news. Aveline gets a lecture on motherhood.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted finds Clive's classic car gathering dust, and comes up with a devious money-making scheme, in which he raffles it as a prize, but he switches it for an old banger before delivering it to the lucky winner. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane and David Griffin.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After years apart, Lionel is reunited with Jean but takes a bigger interest in her daughter. Each believes they have nothing in common any more. First-ever episode of the comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Pearl throws Howard out of the house, prompting him to declare he has sworn off women for good - but Hobbo and friends take it upon themselves to get him to talk to Marina first. Meanwhile, Cooper and Walsh have their car valeted after receiving complaints from the sergeant, Glenda tries to whip herself and Barry into shape in time for Gloria's wedding, and Hobbo finds it difficult to avoid Miss Davenport's attentions at the library.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: After an unidentified burnt body is found near an RAF base, Gently works alongside Special Branch officers who suspect the victim was involved with the IRA. However, the discovery that a large cache of guns has gone missing turns the case into a hostage situation. Feature-length episode starring Martin Shaw as the 1960s Northumberland detective, with Lee Ingleby and Robert Glenister.

credits.actor: Martin Shaw as the 1960s Northumberland detective

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd expects a confession of guilt when he is summoned to prison by one of the inmates, a former policeman serving life for the murder of his partner. The convict does make a revelation - but what he has to say causes the detective out to re-examine the facts of the old case from every possible angle to assure himself of the man's guilt. Trevor Eve and Felicite du Jeu star.

programme.desc: The soldiers help to rescue hostages in the African state of Mokindi. Meanwhile, Sadie and Paul are reunited. Starring Robson Green and Duncan Bell.

Chrissie tells Owen she is leaving Holby, forcing him to finally make a choice between her and Diane.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A football fiasco results in a medical disaster for the local team's star player, and consultant Max receives devastating news about the A&E's future. programme.desc: Ian tells Pat he and Cindy are back together, the news goes round the square like wildfire. Sharon is dreading the return of Grant.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian introduces Cindy to Steve and Hattie. Grant is expected back any moment, but Phil returns and announces that the police have refused bail.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An expectant mother on her way to hospital is involved in a major traffic accident, and Pearce finds himself acting as a midwife.

programme.desc: Archie announces his engagement to Lexie, but does not get the reaction he expects when Hector makes a harsh prediction, and the two men end up exchanging angry words. Meanwhile, Molly's prodigal brother returns, throwing himself on her mercy. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim sets off to find out who stole the priceless porcelain figures he was supposed to be guarding for Charlie. His main suspects are the current owners, with whom Charlie is in negotiation for their sale.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Shifty slinks back home to Grandad's. As Billy's ex-wife moves away, the lovely Leonora moves in to her old house.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Yvonne organises a petition to get rid of Mr Partridge, who has been antagonising the staff, but there's no sign of the offending puppeteer. Ted and Spike return to their chalet for the night and see what appears to be his body floating in the pool with a knife in his back. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Diane Holland.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.sub-title: You Must Remember This - Part Two
programme.desc: Second of two specials featuring clips from past episodes. With Alistair and Judith now married, and Sandy and Harry gone to Canada, Lionel and Jean reminisce on their own.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard)
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A horse trainer with money worries is found hanged, and suicide is suspected until tests reveal he was drugged shortly before his death. Lynley discovers the cove on the victim's estate was used to land contraband, and connects the death to a smuggling racket, but Havers suspects the answer lies with the local riding community. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A millionaire businessman is found dead a year after his disappearance. Evidence suggests he was imprisoned in a cellar immediately before his death, and it's not long before a second body is discovered at the scene. The other corpse has been dead for far longer - and it seems both murders could be the work of an unlikely suspect.

programme.sub-title: A Lack of Control - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Adam's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Phil tempts fate by flirting with Samantha, while Suzie monitors a recently released child abuser, but makes the mistake of contacting his daughter - who is so distressed that she attempts suicide shortly afterwards.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra returns to Holby with his nephew, who needs an urgent transplant. Ric is unable to operate because of the injury to his hand - but he relents when the patient's mother reveals a secret. Owen fears he might get sacked for hitting Amy's stepfather, thereby jeopardising his access to Katie. Diane tries to keep Laura from turning on her ex, but when she learns about his clandestine relationship with Chrissie, tragedy strikes.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean faces a tough time as an injured fireman and his pregnant girlfriend land him with a moral dilemma. Penny helps Josh cope with his gambling addiction and George has a bad day as increasing pressure from Max forces her to burn the midnight oil. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson, Gerald Kyd and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Phil's infatuation with each other is starting to affect the pub and garage as they are devoting more time to each other rather then their work.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil visits Grant in prison and tells him Ricky is going off to work for Frank. Aiden learns he may not be able to play again.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: As everyone comes to terms with the shocking events, Lexie fears Hector's dire prediction may come true and the wedding will be jinxed. Her anxieties are increased when her mother arrives at Glenbogle in dramatic fashion, immediately treading on Molly's toes by taking control. Alastair Mackenzie, Dawn Steele and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie ensures Aveline and her first granddaughter are brought home in style. Leonora continues to fascinate the Boswell boys.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The mystery of the body in the swimming pool continues. Anxious not to alarm the guests, Clive orders the pool lights to be turned off so that the corpse cannot be seen - but instead Fred and the Yellowcoats plunge the whole camp into darkness.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The medic investigates the death of a strangled young gypsy girl, and must tread carefully as prejudice rears its head. Drama, starring Craig MacLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The appeal of a man convicted of murder and mutilation forces Grace to question the decision she made on the case 30 years ago. Someone who appears to be copying his chilling tactics sends the team footage of a new victim having his finger cut off. At the same time, Grace receives threats and a macabre package - a jar of pickled, severed fingers. Sue Johnston and Trevor Eve star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness recreate the classic 1980s Tom Cruise vehicle Top Gun, with a little help from Keith Allen, Adam C Booth, Paul Elliott, Sarah Parish, George Potts, Marc Warren and Kriss Akabusi.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A garden makeover aims to save a Devon mother from going potty, Plus, plans for a 'totally bling' Essex orangery have a woman seeing red, and a couple in Hampshire exceed their huge budget. Property rejuvenation show, presented by Linda Barker.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is babysitting the Neighbours' toddler. The baby flees and kidnaps Fizz mistaking him for a plush toy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a machine which stops toast from landing butter-side down. Magoo sees some floating toast and believes a ghost is haunting their house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is on a beach and that sailors are emptying their oil tanker right into the ocean..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wicket's new, expensive perfume on the floor. Can he hide the crime and cover his tracks?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Team Tennyson goes international in the Omni-Copter and the first stop is for a hike in the Scottish Highlands.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: The monsters celebrate Bad Friday by trying to win the Screamie for the best scare.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Wet Wet Wet singer Marti Pellow, chefs Brian Turner and Cherish Finden, and seafood expert Dan the Fish Man.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up creamy seaside pie - their take on fish pie - and also prepare chilli and nachos, big burrito cake filled with sweet potatoes, smoky peppers and spicy rice, and finish off with their New York-style cheesecake topped with strawberries. Their guest is Rachel Ama, who cooks her harissa hotpot - aubergine cooked in a hot and spicy sauce.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh surprises a group of senior citizens in Thornton Heath, turning an urban wasteland into a welcoming oasis of swaying grasses and pretty daisy flowers. The experts share tips on how to achieve the look of a miniature prairie even in a tiny space, the tricks to creating a cost-effective water feature from skip material, and how to choose the best low-maintenance shrubs to green up even the shadiest of spots.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow George Jeffers threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, which he believes is potentially lethal, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. Detective drama, guest starring David Haig and Nigel Whitmey, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as rugby player Shane Williams, Coronation Street's Sair Khan, comedian Milton Jones and former Paralympic athlete Tanni Grey-Thompson pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show, albeit without a studio audience for the first time ever due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
