programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz, controlling a robot, distributes ice cream to everyone in the city. When Magoo mistakes him for a monster, he gets sprayed with ice cream..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: At the Heart of the Crater
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is at the foot of a volcano, but in fact, he's next to a huge soup vat. And he sets it all awry..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz invents a cucumber that turns people into an object of worship. When Magoo sees people being drawn to Fizz and Weasel, he thinks it's zombies!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Back stateside, Ben can't get into a cat cosplay competition.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Sacrifice at the Edge of Time
programme.desc: Po decides it's time to figure out a way to defeat Jindiao once and for all before time runs out..

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis gives Hank a basketball.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show presented by John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The first episode features spring roast chicken, a fruity curry, Victoria sponge, cheat's raspberry jam and easy cheese scones, and a simple souffle.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott embarks on a journey across the Mediterranean on a 44ft catamaran, preparing a variety of delicious recipes along the way. In this first edition, skipper Jean-Hughes teaches him the basics of sailing, and they drop anchor in a crystal-clear cove on the island of Lavezzi, where Ainsley tries his hand at paddle-boarding. The chef then prepares seafood skewers with pepperonata, and a quick and tasty Corsican mint omelette.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker chooses her favourite, most accessible family treks in search of the perfect walk with a view that anyone can tackle in a morning or afternoon ramble, venturing off the beaten track and discovering some of Britain's most breath-taking scenery.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show, albeit without a studio audience for the first time ever due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Connie Bishop keeps waking in the night, convinced she has an intruder, but most of the villagers in Badger's Drift dismiss her fears as an overactive imagination. Days later, a local councillor thought to have been obsessed with her is found murdered in her garden, and the ensuing investigation by Barnaby and Jones uncovers jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with a few secrets. Guest starring Paul Kaye, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family-themed edition of the game show. Here, instead of teaming up with strangers, the Hartes from Co Antrim work alongside their family members as they pit their general-knowledge know-how against one of the finest quiz brains in the country.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: A medical train rolls into town, providing miracle surgeries and carrying a surprise for Gabriel - a glamorous older surgeon from his past. While he is reminiscing with his old colleague, a vicious attack on one of the team shocks the medics and leaves Lydia reeling, and an elderly British man arrives in India on a romantic mission. Can the doctors help him in his quest? Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Neil Morrissey and Amrita Acharia, with a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne decides that honesty is required, and hopes that seeking confession with Caroline will appease her guilt and lay to rest the ghosts from her past. However, she has sorely underestimated Lady Brockenhurst, who sets about unearthing the secrets that bind the families together. Hosting a prestigious dinner party, she invites a special guest whose presence reveals a deceit James Trenchard would wish to keep private.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Peter Cole is worried about the press interest following Maggie's interview and the online petition calling for his resignation over the scandal. Meanwhile, Alex is greeted at work by two money lenders, who have found him because his girlfriend Roxanna's picture appeared in the papers. Author Marcus Ormansby gives a talk at the school, and finds that romance is blossoming between him and Jill. Later, Maggie's visit to Kelly's salon is tense, but they have a heart to heart, leading Kelly to return home to husband Neil and take action over their 'lottery' money.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family and friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Lorraine

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: Tenable

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Becky, Sue, Jonny and Simon pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is an underlying tension between Paddy and Chas. Jacob starts to suspect that Pollard might like Brenda a little more than he is making out, and David gets some good news.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: It becomes clear that Gemma is not coping with motherhood and even the health visitor question her about her state of mind. But later, as the babies' crying escalates, she heads into the yard to calm herself - and realises with horror she is locked out. Alya introduces Yasmeen to a police officer who has information about Geoff - but scared, she refuses to listen and rushed out. David begs Clayton to leave Shona alone, Tyrone gives Arthur a piece of his mind for standing Evelyn up, and Norris reluctantly joins Ken for the Stillwaters' art class.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: The sunny summer season continues, as the Richardsons celebrate a christening at the Cathedral, Jeremy and Stuart have a big performance and Dean Sarah has her portrait painted. Siriol Jenkins narrates.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bernie arrives to find Gemma in such a distressed state, so she agrees to move in and help with the babies - on the condition that she doesn't tell Chesney that Gemma isn't coping. Nick tries to talk to Shona but she refuses to see him, passing on a message to David instead. Arthur apologises to Evelyn and asks her to give him another chance, and Ken and Norris sneak out to the Rovers for a treat.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: As the investigation takes a shocking turn, secrets rise to the surface. When Andrew was living in Edinburgh, a strange turn of events brought him face to face with an old acquaintance, whose deeply corrosive influence becomes clear. Meanwhile, the tragic recent history of Laura's family helps explain the deep bond she and Katy share, as well as the lengths Laura will go to for those she loves. Will her past catch up with her, just as Andrew's did? Thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Serial Killer with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: An interview with Lorenzo Gilyard, who was convicted of killing six people in and around Missouri between 1977 and 1993, and suspected of murdering a further seven more, earning him six life sentences. His prolific spree saw him labelled the Kansas City Strangler, and despite overwhelming DNA evidence pointing to his guilt, he continues to protest his innocence to this day. Here, Piers Morgan sets out to discover what drove a seemingly well-adjusted family man to kill.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Trish returns to the scene of the crime in the hope it will prompt her to remember something more about the attack, while DC Katie Harford thinks she has a strong lead when she discovers a new suspect who doesn't have an alibi. Cath reveals interesting new information about the night of her party, while a match is made for the male DNA found on Trish. An unknown woman walks into the police station - and delivers some devastating new information when interviewed by Ellie and Hardy. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, the doctor witnesses first-hand what goes on under the knife during a kidney transplant. Kylie Pentelow also meets a young woman who survived terminal cancer following a breakthrough clinical trial.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Forest ranger Felicity Ward is blinded by mysterious lights while driving at night in the village of Cooper Hill and the next morning her car is found abandoned at the roadside, followed closely by the discovery of her body. Visiting UFO spotters in the village are convinced aliens are responsible, but as Barnaby and Nelson try to get to the truth, they unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets along the way. Michelle Collins, Steve Evets, Alison Steadman, Steve Oram and Pip Torrens guest star.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Euston is evacuated during Friday rush hour - leaving passengers there and in Birmingham New Street station stranded, confused and angry. Driver Andy reveals just how close his train came to disaster on the tracks and train dispatcher and former bank manager David imparts his worldly wisdom to a new recruit on his first shift. A train runs a red signal at Birmingham, so engineers have to work through the night to move the stranded locomotive, investigate the cause and get things back up and running before the morning rush.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Kate, the owner of an old-fashioned seaside cafe forms an unlikely friendship with Koji, an African asylum seeker. When Kate finds out that her new acquaintance is a doctor but he is prohibited from working whilst seeking asylum, she hatches a plan that may be mutually beneficial to both involved. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne decides that honesty is required, and hopes that seeking confession with Caroline will appease her guilt and lay to rest the ghosts from her past. However, she has sorely underestimated Lady Brockenhurst, who sets about unearthing the secrets that bind the families together. Hosting a prestigious dinner party, she invites a special guest whose presence reveals a deceit James Trenchard would wish to keep private.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is devastated about Shona's divorce request but claims it will give him a chance to move on - and when he finds Alina alone in Victoria Garden, it is clear there is a spark between them. News of a family wedding gives Alya the chance she needs to get Yasmeen away from Geoff. The only problem is, they are not invited. Bernie forces Gemma to seek medical help, Evelyn summons Claudia for another makeover and Charles is outraged to discover Ken has smuggled Eccles the dog into his apartment.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Six-part series following Kate, a working-class woman who runs an old-fashioned cafe in a seaside town, as she develops a strong, if sometimes volatile, friendship with an asylum-seeking African doctor, Koji. With Kate and Koji's undercover clinic in full swing, the last thing they need is a visit from Dr Radwan. Medium keeps Koji calm, and Kate cooks up a surefire way to get back at an adversary. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn, Jimmy Akingbola, Blake Harrison, Barbara Flynn and Victor McGuire.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An argument in the Rovers turns to blows when David accuses Seb of being jealous of his friendship with Alina - and when Emma realises her boyfriend still has feeling for his ex, she tells him to find somewhere else to stay. Gemma plays down her depression and assures the doctor she is just exhausted, leaving Bernie frustrated by her daughter's refusal to accept help. Alya and Ryan tell Yasmeen they have been invited to Zeedan's wedding in Spain. Now all they have to do is tell Geoff, who is not on the guest list.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie is horrified that her comments about Roxanna have been interpreted by her Polish father Emil as racist, and she is relieved when they understand what she actually did say. Peter has to contend with a campaign for his resignation, as journalists try to dig up his family skeletons. Meanwhile, money lenders Patrick and Phil put the pressure on Alex to repay his debts, and Marcus and Jill's relationship blossoms when he accompanies her to the planning meeting at the village hall for the village celebrations.

programme.desc: A customer faces a challenging fitting, and another bride disagrees with her mother about how her dress should look.

programme.desc: Bride-to-be Hannah has already purchased two gowns, but unimpressed by either, she returns to the salon hoping to find a gown that represents her bridal fantasy.

programme.desc: Part one of two. The veteran broadcaster follows life inside two prisons holding some of America's most notorious female criminals - Indiana Women's Prison and Rockville Correctional Facility in the same US state. Among the inmates he meets in the first edition are Sarah Pender, who went on the run while serving 110 years for double murder, before being captured four months later, and Martha Search, who is looking forward to getting to grips with modern technology when her 20-year sentence comes to an end.

programme.desc: The case of a missing Californian teenager, who was presumed to have run away. However, her body turned up in a ditch 20 miles away.
